string.text: Get Next Task
Receive the next task.
I need you to report to someone in the field. I have marked his location on your PDA.
Good luck stalker.
Sniper
Eliminate a target from a distance.
I have a high-value target that has been located. He is not easy to get to so I need someone who is an extremely accurate long-range precision shooter.
Excellent marksmanship. Well done.
Assault Enemy Camp
Lead a squad in an assault on an enemy encampment.
We're preparing an assault on an enemy camp. For this occasion, I've ensured everyone has been issued new weapons. As for you, I need you to be on point for the initial attack.
Excellent work. You are a fine warrior.
Defend Military Base
Defend the Military base against an enemy assault.
Enemy forces have been spotted in the area. I have reason to suspect they are plotting an assault on our base. Take your squad out and make contact. Neutralize the threat.
Excellent work. You have done well.
On Ukraine's Secret Service
Extract the undercover agent from the enemy faction. Eliminate the other members of the squad and escort him back to the base. The spy has an SVD.

We have an agent undercover in an enemy faction, however we fear he's being suspected. He missed the last few contacts and hasn't left any more messages. He's probably being kept under watch so he can't afford to do anything besides playing along but they may decide to get rid of him without waiting for proof so we need to pull him out. We've located him nearby but he's with other stalkers. You need to kill them and escort him back. You'll recognize him by his rifle; an SVD. He'll unfortunately have to shoot back when you attack the group so keep that in mind.
Excellent. I'll have him report at once.
Stop shooting! I'm the spy! Sorry, but had to keep up the show. Let's go back to base now.
This is where we part ways. See you again!
Get Next Task
Receive the next task.
One of our allies needs our help. Report to him and see what assistance you can give.
Good luck out there, rookie.
Battle Plans
Lieutenant Kirillov has learned the location of enemy battle plans and needs them captured.
An informant has revealed the location of the enemy's battle plans. I need you to infiltrate the area and retrieve the plans.
Well done! You have saved many lives with this.
Patrol Local Area
Patrol the area around Agroprom.
It's your turn for sentry duty. Patrol the local area and keep an eye out for any unauthorized personnel.
Good work. The commander will be pleased.
Becoming a Military Stalker
Bring him 8,000 RU to Colonel Kuznetsov as a demonstration of resourcefulness.

Ah, it's good to see some national pride among the youth of today! Let's see...well, you're way too irradiated to pass the physical exam for enlistment. I suppose you were instead thinking of getting commissioned as a Military stalker, eh? We don't just let anyone in, you know.\n \n First, bring 8,000 RU as proof of your ability to survive here in the Zone... Then we can talk.
Hmph, and so it is. You've profited where lesser troops would've died. Consider yourself recruited, soldier. Be sure to keep your nose clean out there.
Under the Rug
Terminate a group of stalkers at the marked location.

There's one delicate matter. The presence of illegals near our base is not advantageous for our future operations. The assignment is this: any authorized personnel or Duty forces you find at the marked location are allowed to go free, but otherwise all those present must be terminated. No matter what agreements they think they have with us, they must be terminated. Do you understand?
Great job. Keep it up, and you'll be in line for a commendation.
Peer Punishment
Retaliate against a site where Ecologists were attacked.

Lately, there's been an increase in illegal stalking activities in the Zone. One such criminal group has attacked some of our scientists. The individuals who perpetrated this despicable act may have disappeared, but there will be punishment nonetheless. Go to the scene of the attack, and enforce martial law on any stalkers camping there.
The task is done? Good job. Maybe now they'll think twice before interfering with the business of our civilians.
Martial Justice
Excute the target for Colonel Kuznetsov.

The SSU keeps me furnished with a list of its most-wanted targets. Some of them are known spies or enemy tacticians. Others, I'm ashamed to say, are deserters and dishonourable insects who have abandoned their comrades-in-arms. And others still are little better than common scum; criminals from the outside world who fled into the Zone to escape justice. The exact crime committed doesn't matter. What matters is one such target has made themselves vulnerable. If you are willing to be his executioner, you can expect a bonus in your next paycheck.
Outstanding work! The ministers at Internal Affairs will be pleased.
Tight Security
Collect %s, and turn them in for a reward.
Some of my friends among the top brass have launched an unofficial program, would you like to take part? It involves putting some stalker scum to rest.

Some of my friends among the top brass have launched an unofficial program. Guard duty gets dull as the months turn into years. So, to keep everyone sharp, the men will be sent out on patrol more often, and the first squad out of each platoon to come back with enough %ses is entitled to a reward. If you're interested, you're more than welcome to take part yourself.
Hm, let me count the patches... Well done, soldier. You've earned this prize.
Collect Expedition Reports
Bring some mysterious reports back to base for Colonel Kuznetsov.

Our contact in Cordon has sent us vital information regarding stalker activity in the surrounding areas. You'll need to proceed to the dead drop location that I'll highlight on your PDA. Extract the documents you find within, then report back immediately. It is not glorious work, but it's a decent commission for minimal risk.
Excellent job, soldier. If you glanced at the contents, I hope for your sake you won't go blabbing about them to anyone else.
Find %s for Lt. Kirillov
Lt. Kirillov requires %s to install basic equipment upgrades, as well as expand his stock.

The SSU recently requisitioned the base's tools for their own ends, and we need replacements. While we've been waiting on logistics, the Colonel is getting impatient. So while he holds their feet to the fire, I'm authorized to reward anyone who happens to find rudimentary tools while out on patrol. So, will you keep an eye open for some?
Brilliant. What we need right now is a simple set of tools. Just some basic ones, you understand? More advanced kits aren't a priority right now. Good hunting.
Alright, let me see. Yeah, okay. These will do. Here's your reward. You can consider yourself eligible for basic improvements to your gear, too.
Find %s for Lt. Kirilov
Lt. Kirillov requires %s to install advanced equipment upgrades, as well as expand his stock.

I have enough tools to give our conscripts the edge they need, but Spetsnaz are a little more demanding. So, I still need tools. This time, an advanced kit. Nothing less, you understand? As before, there is fair compensation for anyone who can retrieve such a toolkit and bring it back to base.
That's what I like to hear, soldier. Would you like to make sure your gear is in decent shape before you leave?
Already? Good. Let me take a look. Alright, these will do very nicely! You've earned yourself a bonus. Here, take it.
Find %s for Lt. Kirilov
Lt. Kirillov requires %s to install expert equipment upgrades, as well as expand his stock.

HQ nearly has a full complement of tools now. However, some of the less orthodox gear, the kind used by our military stalkers, will require even more advanced tools to get the most out of them. What I need now are expert tools for calibration work. You've been a reliable person thus far, so I know I can trust you with seeking them out. Will you do it?

Good, I knew you wouldn't let me down on this. Get back with the tools, and I'll even throw in some basic lessons on field maintenance, assuming another mechanic hasn't shown you yet. Good hunting out there, comrade.

Maybe when I show this to the Colonel, he'll finally crack a smile. The stalkers won't know what hit them when the time comes. If you find any more tools, be sure to visit our checkpoint in Cordon or the mobile lab in Yantar. Last I heard, the technicians there require more tools themselves.
Find %s for Lt. Rogovets
Lt. Rogovets requires %s to expand his selection of medical supplies.

We're short on medical supplies and our next bird will not be dropping by any time soon. However, I heard that some stalkers and traders started smuggling those drug-making kits into the Zone. They will come in handy for sure. Will you help me out?

There is. While I can treat the men at base just fine, my ability to keep them supplied while they're out in the field is limited. So, I've been trying to requisition a %s. It'll let me prepare medicine for almost any potential threat or injury a soldier could encounter while out on patrol.\n \n Or at least, it would, but my request keeps getting postponed. Every second could save a life, so my proposition is this: if you find a decent kit, I'll pay you out of my own wallet for it, no fuss. Just bring one to me as soon as you can.
You managed to find a decent kit? Let me see. Oh, wow. This'll be good. I expect the survival rate of our patrols to increase dramatically from today on.
